column4: The proverbs of Solomon son of David king of Israel
column5: The proverbs of Solomon, son of David, king of Israel:

column4: To know wisdom and instruction to understand words of insight
column5: To know wisdom and instruction, to understand words of insight,

column4: to receive instruction in wise dealing in righteousness justice and equity
column5: to receive instruction in wise dealing, in righteousness, justice, and equity;
column6: Receive, Instruction, Dealing, Wise, Righteousness, Justice, Equity

column4: to give prudence to the simple knowledge and discretion to the youth
column5: to give prudence to the simple, knowledge and discretion to the youth—

column4: Let the wise hear and increase in learning and the one who understands obtain guidance
column5: Let the wise hear and increase in learning, and the one who understands obtain guidance,

column4: to understand a proverb and a saying the words of the wise and their riddles
column5: to understand a proverb and a saying, the words of the wise and their riddles.

column4: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge fools despise wisdom and instruction
column5: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge; fools despise wisdom and instruction.
column6: Fear, Beginning, Knowledge, Fools, Despise, Wisdom, Instruction

column4: Hear my son your father’s instruction and forsake not your mother’s teaching
column5: Hear, my son, your father’s instruction, and forsake not your mother’s teaching,
column6: hear, Son, Father, Instruction, Forsake, Mother, Teaching

column4: for they are a graceful garland for your head and pendants for your neck
column5: for they are a graceful garland for your head and pendants for your neck.

column4: My son if sinners entice you do not consent
column5: My son, if sinners entice you, do not consent.

column4: If they say Come with us let us lie in wait for blood let us ambush the innocent without reason
column5: If they say, “Come with us, let us lie in wait for blood; let us ambush the innocent without reason;
column6: Come, Lie, Wait, Blood, Ambush, Innocent, Reason

column4: like Sheol let us swallow them alive and whole like those who go down to the pit
column5: like Sheol let us swallow them alive, and whole, like those who go down to the pit;
column6: Sheol, Swallow, Alive, Whole, Down, Pit

column4: we shall find all precious goods we shall fill our houses with plunder
column5: we shall find all precious goods, we shall fill our houses with plunder;

column4: throw in your lot among us we will all have one purse
column5: throw in your lot among us; we will all have one purse”—

column4: my son do not walk in the way with them hold back your foot from their paths
column5: my son, do not walk in the way with them; hold back your foot from their paths,
column6: Son, Walk, Way, Hold, Foot, Paths

column4: for their feet run to evil and they make haste to shed blood
column5: for their feet run to evil, and they make haste to shed blood.
column6: Feet, Run, Evil, Haste, Shed, Blood

column4: For in vain is a net spread in the sight of any bird
column5: For in vain is a net spread in the sight of any bird,

column4: but these men lie in wait for their own blood they set an ambush for their own lives
column5: but these men lie in wait for their own blood; they set an ambush for their own lives.

column4: Such are the ways of everyone who is greedy for unjust gain it takes away the life of its possessors
column5: Such are the ways of everyone who is greedy for unjust gain; it takes away the life of its possessors.
column6: Ways, Greedy, Unjust, Gain, Away, Life, Possessors

column4: Wisdom cries aloud in the street in the markets she raises her voice
column5: Wisdom cries aloud in the street, in the markets she raises her voice;

column4: at the head of the noisy streets she cries out at the entrance of the city gates she speaks
column5: at the head of the noisy streets she cries out; at the entrance of the city gates she speaks:
column6: Head, Noisy, Cries, Entrance, City gate, Speaks

column4: How long O simple ones will you love being simple How long will scoffers delight in their scoffing and fools hate knowledge
column5: “How long, O simple ones, will you love being simple? How long will scoffers delight in their scoffing and fools hate knowledge?
column6: Simple, Love, Scoffers, Delight, Fools, Knowledge

column4: If you turn at my reproof behold I will pour out my spirit to you I will make my words known to you
column5: If you turn at my reproof, behold, I will pour out my spirit to you; I will make my words known to you.
column6: Turn, Reproof, Behold, Pour, Spirit, Words, Known

column4: Because I have called and you refused to listen have stretched out my hand and no one has heeded
column5: Because I have called and you refused to listen, have stretched out my hand and no one has heeded,

column4: because you have ignored all my counsel and would have none of my reproof
column5: because you have ignored all my counsel and would have none of my reproof,

column4: I also will laugh at your calamity I will mock when terror strikes you
column5: I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when terror strikes you,

column4: when terror strikes you like a storm and your calamity comes like a whirlwind when distress and anguish come upon you
column5: when terror strikes you like a storm and your calamity comes like a whirlwind, when distress and anguish come upon you.
column6: Terror, Strikes, Storm, Calamity, Whirlwind, Distress, Anguish

column4: Then they will call upon me but I will not answer they will seek me diligently but will not find me
column5: Then they will call upon me, but I will not answer; they will seek me diligently but will not find me.

column4: Because they hated knowledge and did not choose the fear of the LORD
column5: Because they hated knowledge and did not choose the fear of the LORD,

column4: would have none of my counsel and despised all my reproof
column5: would have none of my counsel and despised all my reproof,

column4: therefore they shall eat the fruit of their way and have their fill of their own devices
column5: therefore they shall eat the fruit of their way, and have their fill of their own devices.
column6: Eat, Fruit, Way, Fill, Own, Devices

column4: For the simple are killed by their turning away and the complacency of fools destroys them
column5: For the simple are killed by their turning away, and the complacency of fools destroys them;
column6: Simple, Killed, Turning away, Complacency, Fools, Destroy

column4: but whoever listens to me will dwell secure and will be at ease without dread of disaster
column5: but whoever listens to me will dwell secure and will be at ease, without dread of disaster.”
column6: Listens, Dwell, Secure, Ease, Dread, Disaster

column4: My son if you receive my words and treasure up my commandments with you
column5: My son, if you receive my words and treasure up my commandments with you,

column4: making your ear attentive to wisdom and inclining your heart to understanding
column5: making your ear attentive to wisdom and inclining your heart to understanding;

column4: yes if you call out for insight and raise your voice for understanding
column5: yes, if you call out for insight and raise your voice for understanding,

column4: if you seek it like silver and search for it as for hidden treasures
column5: if you seek it like silver and search for it as for hidden treasures,

column4: then you will understand the fear of the Lord and find the knowledge of God
column5: then you will understand the fear of the Lord and find the knowledge of God.

column4: For the Lord gives wisdom from his mouth come knowledge and understanding
column5: For the Lord gives wisdom; from his mouth come knowledge and understanding;

column4: he stores up sound wisdom for the upright he is a shield to those who walk in integrity
column5: he stores up sound wisdom for the upright; he is a shield to those who walk in integrity,

column4: guarding the paths of justice and watching over the way of his saints
column5: guarding the paths of justice and watching over the way of his saints.

column4: Then you will understand righteousness and justice and equity every good path
column5: Then you will understand righteousness and justice and equity, every good path;

column4: for wisdom will come into your heart and knowledge will be pleasant to your soul
column5: for wisdom will come into your heart, and knowledge will be pleasant to your soul;

column4: discretion will watch over you understanding will guard you
column5: discretion will watch over you, understanding will guard you,

column4: delivering you from the way of evil from men of perverted speech
column5: delivering you from the way of evil, from men of perverted speech,

column4: who forsake the paths of uprightness to walk in the ways of darkness
column5: who forsake the paths of uprightness to walk in the ways of darkness,

column4: who rejoice in doing evil and delight in the perverseness of evil
column5: who rejoice in doing evil and delight in the perverseness of evil,

column4: men whose paths are crooked and who are devious in their ways
column5: men whose paths are crooked, and who are devious in their ways.

column4: So you will be delivered from the forbidden woman from the adulteress with her smooth words
column5: So you will be delivered from the forbidden woman, from the adulteress with her smooth words,

column4: who forsakes the companion of her youth and forgets the covenant of her God
column5: who forsakes the companion of her youth and forgets the covenant of her God;

column4: for her house sinks down to death and her paths to the departed
column5: for her house sinks down to death, and her paths to the departed;

column4: none who go to her come back nor do they regain the paths of life
column5: none who go to her come back, nor do they regain the paths of life.

column4: So you will walk in the way of the good and keep to the paths of the righteous
column5: So you will walk in the way of the good and keep to the paths of the righteous.

column4: For the upright will inhabit the land and those with integrity will remain in it
column5: For the upright will inhabit the land, and those with integrity will remain in it,

column4: but the wicked will be cut off from the land and the treacherous will be rooted out of it
column5: but the wicked will be cut off from the land, and the treacherous will be rooted out of it.

column4: Hear O sons a father's instruction and be attentive that you may gain insight
column5: Hear, O sons, a father's instruction, and be attentive, that you may gain insight,

column4: for I give you good precepts do not forsake my teaching
column5: for I give you good precepts; do not forsake my teaching

column4: When I was a son with my father tender the only one in the sight of my mother
column5: When I was a son of my father, tender, the only one in the sight of my mother,

column4: he taught me and said to me Let your heart hold fast my words keep my commandments and live
column5: he taught me and said to me, "Let your heart hold fast my words; keep my commandments, and live.

column4: Get wisdom get insight do not forget and do not turn away from the words of my mouth
column5: Get wisdom; get insight; do not forget, and do not turn away from the words of my mouth.

column4: Do not forsake her and she will keep you love her and she will guard you
column5: Do not forsake her, and she will keep you; love her, and she will guard you.

column4: The beginning of wisdom is this Get wisdom and whatever you get get insight
column5: The beginning of wisdom is this: Get wisdom, and whatever you get, get insight.

column4: Prize her highly and she will exalt you she will honor you if you embrace her
column5: Prize her highly, and she will exalt you; she will honor you if you embrace her.

column4: She will place on your head a graceful garland she will bestow on you a beautiful crown
column5: She will place on your head a graceful garland; she will bestow on you a beautiful crown."

column4: Hear my son and accept my words that the years of your life may be many
column5: Hear, my son, and accept my words, that the years of your life may be many.

column4: I have taught you the way of wisdom I have led you in the paths of uprightness
column5: I have taught you the way of wisdom; I have led you in the paths of uprightness.

column4: When you walk your step will not be hampered and if you run you will not stumble
column5: When you walk, your step will not be hampered, and if you run, you will not stumble.

column4: Keep hold of instruction do not let go guard her for she is your life
column5: Keep hold of instruction; do not let go; guard her, for she is your life.

column4: Do not enter the path of the wicked and do not walk in the way of evil
column5: Do not enter the path of the wicked, and do not walk in the way of evil.

column4: Avoid it do not go on it turn away from it and pass on
column5: Avoid it; do not go on it; turn away from it and pass on.

column4: For they cannot sleep unless they have done wrong they are robbed of sleep unless they have made someone stumble
column5: For they cannot sleep unless they have done wrong; they are robbed of sleep unless they have made someone stumble.
column6: Cannot sleep, Robbed of Sleep, Stumble

column4: For they eat the bread of wickedness and drink the wine of violence
column5: For they eat the bread of wickedness and drink the wine of violence.

column4: But the path of the righteous is like the light of dawn which shines brighter and brighter until full day
column5: But the path of the righteous is like the light of dawn, which shines brighter and brighter until full day.

column4: The way of the wicked is like deep darkness they do not know over what they stumble
column5: The way of the wicked is like deep darkness; they do not know over what they stumble.

column4: My son be attentive to my words incline your ear to my sayings
column5: My son, be attentive to my words; incline your ear to my sayings.

column4: Let them not escape from your sight keep them within your heart
column5: Let them not escape from your sight; keep them within your heart.

column4: For they are life to those who find them and healing to all their flesh
column5: For they are life to those who find them, and healing to all their flesh.

column4: Keep your heart with all vigilance for from it flow the springs of life
column5: Keep your heart with all vigilance, for from it flow the springs of life.

column4: Put away from you crooked speech and put devious talk far from you
column5: Put away from you crooked speech, and put devious talk far from you.

column4: Let your eyes look directly forward and your gaze be straight before you
column5: Let your eyes look directly forward, and your gaze be straight before you.

column4: Ponder the path of your feet then all your ways will be sure
column5: Ponder the path of your feet; then all your ways will be sure.

column4: Do not swerve to the right or to the left turn your foot away from evil
column5: Do not swerve to the right or to the left; turn your foot away from evil.

column4: My son pay attention to my wisdom turn your ear to my understanding
column5: My son, pay attention to my wisdom, turn your ear to my understanding,

column4: that you may retain discretion and your lips may keep knowledge
column5: that you may retain discretion and your lips may keep knowledge.

column4: For the lips of a forbidden woman drip honey and her mouth is smoother than oil
column5: For the lips of a forbidden woman drip honey, and her mouth is smoother than oil,

column4: but in the end she is bitter as wormwood sharp as a two edged sword
column5: but in the end she is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a two-edged sword.

column4: Her feet go down to death her steps lead straight to Sheol
column5: Her feet go down to death; her steps lead straight to Sheol.

column4: For she strays far from the path of life her ways wander and she does not know it
column5: For she strays far from the path of life; her ways wander, and she does not know it.

column4: So now listen to me sons and do not depart from the words of my mouth
column5: So now, listen to me, sons, and do not depart from the words of my mouth:
column6: Heed Instruction, Avoid Temptation, Choose Wisely

column4: Avoid her path go not near her dwelling place
column5: Avoid her path, go not near her dwelling place,

column4: lest you give your honor to others and your years to the cruel
column5: lest you give your honor to others and your years to the cruel,

column4: lest strangers feast on your wealth and your labors enrich the house of foreigners
column5: lest strangers feast on your wealth, and your labors enrich the house of foreigners.

column4: Then you will groan in the end when your body and flesh are consumed
column5: Then you will groan in the end, when your body and flesh are consumed.

column4: And you will say How I hated discipline and how my heart spurned correction
column5: And you will say, "How I hated discipline, and how my heart spurned correction!

column4: I did not listen to the voice of my teachers or incline my ear to my instructors
column5: I did not listen to the voice of my teachers, or incline my ear to my instructors.

column4: I was close to all evil in the midst of the assembly and the congregation
column5: I was close to all evil in the midst of the assembly and the congregation."

column4: Drink water from your own cistern running water from your own well
column5: Drink water from your own cistern, running water from your own well.

column4: Should your springs overflow in the streets your streams of water in the public squares
column5: Should your springs overflow in the streets, your streams of water in the public squares?

column4: Let them be yours alone never to be shared with strangers
column5: Let them be yours alone, never to be shared with strangers.

column4: May your fountain be blessed and may you rejoice in the wife of your youth
column5: May your fountain be blessed, and may you rejoice in the wife of your youth.

column4: A loving doe a graceful deer let her breasts satisfy you always may you ever be intoxicated with her love
column5: A loving doe, a graceful deer—let her breasts satisfy you always, may you ever be intoxicated with her love.

column4: Why my son be intoxicated with another mans wife Why embrace the bosom of a wayward woman
column5: Why, my son, be intoxicated with another man's wife? Why embrace the bosom of a wayward woman?

column4: For a mans ways are before the eyes of the Lord and he ponders all his paths
column5: For a man's ways are before the eyes of the Lord, and he ponders all his paths.

column4: The iniquities of the wicked ensnare them and the cords of their sin bind them
column5: The iniquities of the wicked ensnare them, and the cords of their sin bind them.

column4: They die for lack of discipline and because of their great folly they are led astray
column5: They die for lack of discipline, and because of their great folly they are led astray.

column4: My son if you have put up security for your neighbor have given your pledge for a stranger
column5: My son, if you have put up security for your neighbor, have given your pledge for a stranger,

column4: if you are snared in the words of your mouth caught in the words of your mouth
column5: if you are snared in the words of your mouth, caught in the words of your mouth,

column4: then do this my son and save yourself for you have come into the hand of your neighbor go hasten and plead urgently with your neighbor
column5: then do this, my son, and save yourself, for you have come into the hand of your neighbor: go, hasten, and plead urgently with your neighbor.

column4: Give your eyes no sleep and your eyelids no slumber
column5: Give your eyes no sleep and your eyelids no slumber;

column4: save yourself like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter like a bird from the hand of the fowler
column5: save yourself like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter, like a bird from the hand of the fowler.

column4: Go to the ant O sluggard consider her ways and be wise
column5: Go to the ant, O sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise.

column4: Without having any chief officer or ruler
column5: Without having any chief, officer, or ruler,

column4: she prepares her bread in summer and gathers her food in harvest
column5: she prepares her bread in summer and gathers her food in harvest.

column4: How long will you lie there O sluggard When will you arise from your sleep
column5: How long will you lie there, O sluggard? When will you arise from your sleep?

column4: A little sleep a little slumber a little folding of the hands to rest
column5: A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest,

column4: and poverty will come upon you like a robber and want like an armed man
column5: and poverty will come upon you like a robber, and want like an armed man.

column4: A worthless person a wicked man goes about with crooked speech
column5: A worthless person, a wicked man, goes about with crooked speech,

column4: winks with his eyes signals with his feet points with his finger
column5: winks with his eyes, signals with his feet, points with his finger,

column4: with perverted heart devises evil continually sowing discord
column5: with perverted heart devises evil, continually sowing discord;

column4: therefore calamity will come upon him suddenly in a moment he will be broken beyond healing
column5: therefore calamity will come upon him suddenly; in a moment he will be broken beyond healing.

column4: There are six things that the LORD hates seven that are an abomination to him
column5: There are six things that the LORD hates, seven that are an abomination to him:

column4: haughty eyes a lying tongue and hands that shed innocent blood
column5: haughty eyes, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood,

column4: a heart that devises wicked plans feet that make haste to run to evil
column5: a heart that devises wicked plans, feet that make haste to run to evil,

column4: a false witness who breathes out lies and one who sows discord among brothers
column5: a false witness who breathes out lies, and one who sows discord among brothers.

column4: My son keep your fathers commandment,and forsake not your mothers teaching
column5: My son, keep your father's commandment, and forsake not your mother's teaching.

column4: Bind them on your heart always tie them around your neck
column5: Bind them on your heart always; tie them around your neck.

column4: When you walk they will lead you when you lie down they will watch over you and when you awake they will talk with you
column5: When you walk, they will lead you; when you lie down, they will watch over you; and when you awake, they will talk with you.

column4: For the commandment is a lamp and the teaching a light and the reproofs of discipline are the way of life
column5: For the commandment is a lamp and the teaching a light, and the reproofs of discipline are the way of life,

column4: to preserve you from the evil woman from the smooth tongue of the adulteress
column5: to preserve you from the evil woman, from the smooth tongue of the adulteress.

column4: Do not desire her beauty in your heart and do not let her capture you with her eyelashes
column5: Do not desire her beauty in your heart, and do not let her capture you with her eyelashes;

column4: for the price of a prostitute is only a loaf of bread but a married womanhunts down a precious life
column5: for the price of a prostitute is only a loaf of bread, but a married womanhunts down a precious life.

column4: Can a man carry fire next to his chest and his clothes not be burned
column5: Can a man carry fire next to his chest and his clothes not be burned?

column4: Or can one walk on hot coals and his feet not be scorched
column5: Or can one walk on hot coals and his feet not be scorched?

column4: So is he who goes in to his neighbors wife none who touches her will go unpunished
column5: So is he who goes in to his neighbor's wife; none who touches her will go unpunished.

column4: People do not despise a thief if he steals to satisfy his appetite when he is hungry
column5: People do not despise a thief if he steals to satisfy his appetite when he is hungry,

column4: but if he is caught he will pay sevenfold he will give all the goods of his house
column5: but if he is caught, he will pay sevenfold; he will give all the goods of his house.

column4: He who commits adultery lacks sense he who does it destroys himself
column5: He who commits adultery lacks sense; he who does it destroys himself.

column4: He will get wounds and dishonor and his disgrace will not be wiped away
column5: He will get wounds and dishonor, and his disgrace will not be wiped away.

column4: For jealousy makes a man furious and he will not spare when he takes revenge
column5: For jealousy makes a man furious, and he will not spare when he takes revenge.

column4: He will accept no compensation he will refuse though you multiply gifts
column5: He will accept no compensation; he will refuse though you multiply gifts.

column4: My son keep my words and treasure up my commandments with you
column5: My son, keep my words and treasure up my commandments with you;

column4: keep my commandments and live keep my teaching as the apple of your eye
column5: Keep my commandments and live; keep my teaching as the apple of your eye;
column6: keep, commandments, live, keep, teaching, apple, eye

column4: bind them on your fingers write them on the tablet of your heart
column5: Bind them on your fingers; write them on the tablet of your heart.

column4: Say to wisdom You are my sister and call insight your intimate friend
column5: Say to wisdom, "You are my sister," and call insight your intimate friend,
column6: wisdom, sister, call, insight, intimate, friend

column4: to keep you from the forbidden woman from the adulteress with her smooth words
column5: To keep you from the forbidden woman, from the adulteress with her smooth words.
column6: keep, forbidden, woman, adulteress, smooth, words

column4: For at the window of my house I have looked out through my lattice
column5: For at the window of my house I have looked out through my lattice,

column4: and I have seen among the simple I have perceived among the youths a young man lacking sense
column5: And I have seen among the simple, I have perceived among the youths,A young man lacking sense,
column6: seen, simple, among, precieved, youths, lacking, sense

column4: passing along the street near her corner taking the road to her house
column5: passing along the street near her corner, Taking the road to her house
column6: passing, along, street, corner, road, house

column4: in the twilight in the evening at the time of night and darkness
column5: in the twilight, in the evening, at the time of night and darkness.

column4: And behold the woman meets him dressed as a prostitute, wily of heart
column5: And behold, the woman meets him, dressed as a prostitute, wily of heart.
column6: behold, woman, meets, dressed, prostitute, wily, heart

column4: She is loud and wayward her feet do not stay at home
column5: She is loud and wayward; her feet do not stay at home;

column4: now in the street now in the market and at every corner she lies in wait
column5: Now in the street, now in the market, and at every corner she lies in wait.

column4: She seizes him and kisses him and with bold face she says to him
column5: She seizes him and kisses him, and with bold face she says to him,

column4: I had to offer sacrifices and today I have paid my vows
column5: I had to offer sacrifices, and today I have paid my vows;

column4: so now I have come out to meet you to seek you eagerly and I have found you
column5: So now I have come out to meet you, to seek you eagerly, and I have found you.
column6: out, come, meet, seek, eagerly, found

column4: I have spread my couch with coverings colored linens from Egyptian linen
column5: I have spread my couch with coverings, colored linens from Egyptian linen;
column6: spread, couch, belongings, colored, linens, egyptian, linen, coverings

column4: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh aloes and cinnamon
column5: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

column4: Come let us take our fill of love till morning let us delight ourselves with love
column5: Come, let us take our fill of love till morning; let us delight ourselves with love.

column4: For my husband is not at home he has gone on a long journey
column5: For my husband is not at home; he has gone on a long journey;

column4: he took a bag of money with him at full moon he will come home
column5: He took a bag of money with him; at full moon, he will come home.

column4: With much seductive speech she persuades him with her smooth talk she compels him
column5: With much seductive speech, she persuades him; with her smooth talk, she compels him.

column5: All at once he follows her, as an ox goes to the slaughter, Or as a stag is caught fast

column4: till an arrow pierces its liver as a bird rushes into a snare he does not know that it will cost him his life
column5: till an arrow pierces its liver; As a bird rushes into a snare; he does not know that it will cost him his life.
column6: arrow, pierces, liver, bird, rushes, snare, know, cost, life

column4: And now O sons listen to me and be attentive to the words of my mouth
column5: And now, O sons, listen to me, and be attentive to the words of my mouth.

column4: Let not your heart turn aside to her ways do not stray into her paths
column5: Let not your heart turn aside to her ways; do not stray into her paths,

column4: for many a victim has she laid low and all her slain are a mighty throng
column5: For many a victim has she laid low, and all her slain are a mighty throng.
column6: victim, laid, low, many, slain, mighty, throng

column4: Her house is the way to Sheol going down to the chambers of death
